name: High Cliffs
economy_niches: cliff-slope herb gardens for ritual reagents
culture_adjustments: preference for hidden coves and smuggling lore over large ports
accent enriched with clipped Highland Cant loanwords
seasonal rock-climbing rites keyed to tidal rhythms
ancestor veneration tied to family cliff-sites
constraints: dangerous access for large cargo ships
ritual reagents often require import or difficult cliff-harvest
seasonal road and path closures during storms
notes: source of high-quality ship timbers for State_7 yards
vital lookout stations for estuary currents
local ropecraft prized across state markets
